Description: This is a Vintage Tourneau Wristwatch. It was made specifically for Reader's Digest, circa 1980, as a giveaway prize in a Reader's Digest Contest. It is a Limited Edition Piece - no longer available. The watch features the Reader's Digest Pegasus Logo on the front and back. The watch is New with the original protective plastic covers on the front and back. It has a Genuine Leather strap. It comes with the original Warranty and Instruction pamphlet and case. The watch needs a new battery that should be replaced by a professional watch technician. It is a Quartz watch made of Swiss parts and assembled in Thailand. It has a Stainless Steel Caseback. It is Water-resistant to 100 Ft. The watch band and storage case made in China. The watch with the band is 8 1/2" long. The Tourneau Watch Company was established in 1900 in Western Europe. The Tourneau family immigrated to New York City in 1925. In 1930, they opened their first shop on Madison Avenue and 49th Street in New York. Today, Tourneau is the largest authorized retailer of timepieces in the United States.
